Subject: embedding 2.0...a bad idea?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=334689939

Hi,

I've been struggling with 2.0.1 snapshot for the past few days, and I 
just do not like all the JMX integration.  From the perspective of 
someone just trying to embed heretrix via good old fashioned API calls, 
it makes everything extremely confusing.

Paul was kind enough to make a change that allowed getting an Engine's 
SheetManager via a non-JMX call, but not I'm struggling with adding 
crawl status listeners.  The previous method (implement the 
CrawlStatusListener interface) seems intuitive to me.  The new method 
(??? something to do with ListModuleListener and the sheet manager) has 
stumped me so far, and I'm about ready to give up.  I've been through 
the code, and the closest thing I could find was addFinishedCallback in 
EngineImpl, but I don't really understand what it's doing, and try as I 
might, I can't get similar code to work for me.

So, am I barking up the wrong tree trying to embed heritrix 2?  I'm sure 
making embedding hard is not a goal for 2.0, but was easy embedding 
scratched from the list?  I really like the new sheets as compared to 
the orders xml, but at least that's a beast I know how to tangle with.

To be specific, all I need at this point is to be able to configure a 
crawl (change a few settings in the sheet...this I know how to do), fire 
it up, be notified when it finishes, and be able to stop it prematurely. 
  I'm pretty clear on everything except the notification.  Right now, 
I'm leaning towards just watching the job directory name and waiting for 
it to change to "completed".  Still, that seems a little inelegant.

Any advice would be greatly appreciated,
Micah Wedemeyer
Woodruff Library, Emory University
